titleStmt.title: J. P. Sparks et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4436

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Whereas a judgement was Rendered against Stephen Coleman in the Henry Circuit Court for $60= Fined for keeping a tipling House, and it was, for another person, who had a Right to sell liquors, But said Coleman did not attend the Court, And he was therefore fine for his negligence in the case. He is a very poor man and his wife Subject to Hits monthly. We the undersigned most Respectfully. Ask for you to Remit the aforesaid fine. This 2nd day of November 1863.

J. P. Sparks
Geo. G. Hurrston CHCC
J. N. Oliver
Ham Ellis Depy Clk Co Ct
J M Jones J
J N Webb
Robt B Gray
J. Owens

Henry Cir Ct
vs
Stephen Coleman
$60 --
Tipling

Petition for remission. Respite 12. months.
Nov 3rd 1863
Tho E Bramlette
